Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting Mr. Hernandez Flores's identity documents
Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed; focus on document adequacy
Evidence_Type: Photocopies of passport page and birth certificate
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations regarding identity documentation
Basis_of_Claim: Refugee protection due to flight from El Salvador
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to provide clear, complete, timely, and verifiable identity documents
Proceeding_Type: Refugee claim hearing and subsequent judicial review
Application_Error: Late submission, unclear copies, no originals, no explanation for deficiencies
Review_Outcome: No error found; Board’s decision upheld
Evidence_Ignored: None; evidence was considered but found inadequate
Legal_Standard: Claimants must provide acceptable identity documents or explain their absence
Application_Factor: Timeliness, clarity, completeness, and availability of original documents
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed due to insufficient identity verification
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 101 and related regulations on identity verification
Outcome_of_Review: Dismissed – no question of law or fact certified
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 101, s. 107, and IRPR r. 65
Evidentiary_Issues: Unclear photocopies, lack of originals, late submission
Procedural_Fairness: Claimant had opportunity to present documents but failed to meet requirements
Document_Fraud: Not alleged – issue was authenticity support, not forgery
Credibility_Issues: Not central; decision based on procedural/documentary failure
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Late and incomplete submission of required identity documents
Omission_Type: Failure to provide original documents or explanation for absence
